name: vscode-power-mode
description: Your code is powerful, unleash it! The extension made popular by Code in the Dark has finally made its way to VS Code.

powermode.comboThreshold.description: The combo number needed to activate POWER MODE!!!

powermode.comboTimeout.description: The number of seconds before the combo resets

powermode.enableExplosions.description: Set to false to disable explosions while typing

powermode.enableShake.description: Set to false to disable shaking while typing

powermode.shakeIntensity.description: The intensity with which the screen shakes

powermode.maxExplosions.description: The maximum number of simultaneous explosions

powermode.explosionSize.description: The size of the explosions. For value X, the height is set to X rem and the width to X ch

powermode.explosionFrequency.description: The number of key strokes needed to trigger an explosion. 2 means every second keystroke will explode, 1 means every key stroke.

powermode.explosionOffset.description: The vertical offset of the explosions. Increasing it will move the explosions up, decreasing it will move them down.

powermode.customExplosions.description: Use anything that can go in the 'url()' part of a background image such as a base64 encoded gif or absolute file path WITHOUT quotes. Urls must be https.

powermode.legacyMode.description: If true, POWERMODE will use the small, original explosions that appeared behind the letters instead of the new ones that explode in the lines above the letters.

powermode.explosionMode.description: Determines how the explosions are cycled. 'random' (default) picks from the list randomly. 'sequential' goes through the list in order, and a number will select the explosion at that (zero based)index in the list

powermode.explosionDuration.description: Determines how long an explosion lasts (in milliseconds). Set to 0 for it to last forever.
